intro: Mercurialis acanthocarpa, commonly known as the prickly mercury or sand mercury, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region and parts of southern Europe. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its spiny stems and lobed leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas and dry habitats. Due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
